It is headquartered in Wolfsburg, Lower Saxony, Germany, and is indirectly majority owned by the Austrian Porsche-Piëch family. The company designs, manufactures, and distributes passenger and commercial vehicles, motorcycles, engines, and turbomachinery, and offers related services including financing, leasing, and fleet management. 

On the other hand, Volvo Car Group consists of two Swedish brands, Volvo Cars, and Polestar. Zhejiang Geely Holding Group holds 99% of Volvo Car AB, with the remaining 1% held by Swedish institutional investors. Volvo Cars was initially founded as a collaboration between Volvo and Hertz but is now wholly owned by Volvo Cars.

In 2009, Ford sold Volvo Cars to Chinese Zhejiang Geely Holding Group, making Volvo Cars the first western automotive manufacturer owned by a Chinese company. Additionally, Volvo Car Corporation was part of Ford Motor Company's Premier Automotive Group (PAG), along with Jaguar, Aston Martin, and Land Rover.

In summary, Volkswagen AG owns the Volkswagen car company, while Volvo Car Group is owned by Zhejiang Geely Holding Group, with historical connections to Ford Motor Company.
